column4: I'm having trouble with Openssl, x509 certificates and Windows, someone wanna help?
does it apply to ... Ubuntu?
I'm creating the certificates on an Ubuntu server, trying to use them for an VPN running on Ubunutu.  And I can't find the OpenSSL channel.
what's your problem?
I don't know much about VPNs...but i know a little about openssl+apache

following the guide written by Nate Carlson, I've created a CA, and self-signed certificates.  When I try to import them into my Windows clients, they say the CA isn't supposed to be creating certificates.
Did you self sign the certs, or did you use the CA to sign the certs you generated yourself?
I used the CA.
so your windows client isn't trusting the CA?
or does it say your CA wasn't supposed to sign certs? that wouldn't make sense -- that's the CA's jobs
it says the latter.
I know.  That's what's got me puzzled.
you generated the .key via: openssl genrsa 512/1024 > whatever.key;openssl req -new -key whatever.key > whatever.csr
then, using your existing CA, did: openssl ca -policy policy_anything -out whatever.crt -infiles whatever.csr
No.  I used CA.sh -newca to generate the CA.  THen I used CA.sh -newreq to generate the client certificates.
try doing it the way i just said :)
Then I used CA.sh -sign to sign them.
that way you're generating the certs with SSL, and signing them with the CA
err, openssl*
OK.  I'l try.
you've done -newca?
you do need to do that, in order to sign the .csr with your CA to produce a .crt :p
Yeah I've done the -newca bit.
k', if you need help following the commands i gave you send me a PM and i'll tell them to you in order :p
